intro: Leptochilus laciniatus, commonly known as the slitleaf rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, lobed leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in early spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or arctic environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
